Reviews.Title: “Love the location, staff nice, needs attention”
Reviews.Author: pad_lake
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and we absolutely love this location. That said, the room, when air wasn't moving, smelled of stale smoke. This became glaringly apparent after our first day out of the room. The room types need to be better described, because what I thought was a "suite" was more like a normal hotel room with a mini kitchenette. The floor in the kitchenette was nice laminate wood-look, but while the carpet looked clean, it really wasn't. They really need to wash it. Two main reasons for staying here was the inclusion of a DVD player, so I could do video review (side business) while travelling. I couldn't get the thing to work (audio, but no video - no instructions in the room), and by the time I complained and maintenance came up (over 8 hours), it was too late for me to use this resource. By the way, to use it, tune TV to channel 3 (seriously, who does this anymore with flat screens? changing the source via menu doesn't work). Lastly, the "hot tub" wasn't very hot. It was barely about 10 - 20 degrees warmer than the pool, and on the last night we were staying, the heater was broken, resulting in about a 70 degree hot tub. I can't say it was worth it's price, but you may want to look around for a better alternative if you can find something for the price (aka, if you can get the Drury across the street for close to the price, do it).

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying at A Kennel”
Reviews.Author: AlCzervik1
Reviews.Content: Oh boy where do I start off with this review. First off let me say that I like staying at this particular Interstate exit as its convenient to where I work when I'm in town. Last time I was in town I stayed at the Suburban Extended Stay hotel with is next door to the Candlewood Suites, both hotels are owned by the same company, Lee Hospitality. I had a bad experience there, see my review, thus I decided to try the Candlewood Suites instead as I figured it couldn't be worse..... it was. When I arrived at the hotel I was greeted with the nice aroma of fresh manure fertilizer that was spread on the plants surrounding the hotel. Little did I know once I actually got inside the room that the manure smell was a welcome relief from the horrendous stink that was in the room itself. The room smelled like old, rotten food and feet, ingrained in the carpet, drapes, etc from thousands of travelers cooking smelly foods. I immediately went out and bought 3 air fresheners which masked the smell enough to make the place habitable. This is a pretty typical older Candlewood, very basic, that's why these are budget hotels. I mainly booked it for the kitchen as these hotels have a cooktop, full sized fridge and dishwasher. Everything was going pretty well the first couple of nights then directly across the hall someone checked in with two dogs that had severe separation anxiety. The owners left around 7am and that's when the barking started, NONSTOP, constant, relentless barking/yapping. After about 3 hours I was getting irritated, after 5 hours I was livid and after 12 hours I was about ready to shoot myself. I had a lot of work to get done, which involves number crunching but could not concentrate at all, they could easily use that as a torture method as after several hours I could tell I was entering some mental distress. So I went down to the front desk where the "manager" promptly did absolutely nothing, I wasn't even given the common decency of an apology, no apology and no recourse whatsoever. The barking was treated as nothing more then a joke and I basically just a nuisance to her, she would have been happy to have me checkout right then and leave. She obviously had absolutely ZERO customer service skills whatsoever. I attempted to contact the general manager but he was conveniently "on vacation"...lol...like I believed that. There was no regard for me whatsoever, I had no rights other then moving rooms at my inconvenience. Those people with the dogs should have been told to leave the hotel as many guests were irritated, not just me. Well, the owners finally came back around 7pm and walked the dogs for 5 minutes then headed back out, again the yapping started, more hours passed, more frustration for me, the suffering which started at 7am finally ended at 11pm. The barking only stopped the couple of minutes they were back beyond that it was like a non-stop record playing, no break, no relief, like the Energizer bunny they just kept on going and going. Finally decided to cut my hotel stay short and leave, screwing up my travel plans, the manager was more then happy to see me go I'm sure, she could have cared less. This has to be one of the worst run hotels I've ever seen and I've stayed in hundreds, absolutely zero professionalism. The hotel itself may have rated slightly better without the barking dogs but was still pretty rough. The Internets speeds were awful, couldn't even stream video. The shower was cold and the bed was hard. About the only positive thing was that the cleanliness was good. I've stayed in two Lee Hospitality properties and both were bad experiences, these people are extremely cheap, putting the bare minimum back into their hotels at the expense of the guests, they are pretty much the slumlords of the hotel industry. Bottom line avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Roundabout41348
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights. The clerk at check in was very nice and pleasant. The hotel in general was very clean. They have a small store that has a wide variety of food and other necessities at very reasonable prices. The exercise area was very nice and equipment was in excellent condition. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The room had a full kitchen and everything was very clean and in good repair. The bed was clean and comfortable. Internet was easy to connect to and had adequate speed. Heat and air worked good. Bathroom was very clean with hair dryer and bowed shower curtain and the water was very soft. The room had a flat screen TV and a DVD player with movies available for free at the front desk. The only negatives was the bed was a little close to one wall and it was difficult to get in at night, and one drawer had a few stains in the bottom of it. The rest of the room was spotless. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel near downtown”
Reviews.Author: wvfamily2005
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a recent trip to the Indianapolis Children's Museum. It was about a 10-15 minute drive (on a Saturday morning) to downtown. Very family friendly hotel. Wonderful pool for the kids to play in and they even have free movie rentals. The seperate bedroom was really nice. A bargain price in a great location. There are all sorts of places to eat nearby. We will definitely stay here again on a return trip to Indy!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, family-friendly value”
Reviews.Author: jcodyssey
Reviews.Content: This Candlewood Suites hotel is specifically our hotel to stay in while in Indianapolis. It is consistently clean. It has the right type of amenities for a family with young children (kitchenette, separate bedroom suite if needed, inexpensive snack bar/pantry, washer/dryer, swimming pool, etc.). The sleeper-sofa is not a luxurious night's sleep, but it's clean and in great condition (based on staying in many different rooms over many different vacation and family-reunion stays at this hotel over the years). It is a great value for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service, and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Skate62
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Christmas Day and the front desk was waiting for us. Booked a studio and a one bedroom, and although they didn't connect, reservations gave us rooms next to each other so we could visit with our family. The rooms and bathrooms were immaculate and the kitchen was well equipped with nice cookwear, refrigerator storage dishes, and even paper towels and dish soap. And the best, two brand new stainless steel grills, complete with utensils. For folks who cook out all year long, that was the best. The front desk went out of their way to accomodate us with directions, recommendations, and even a corkscrew! Be sure to visit the Childrens Museum, which is just the best. Couldn't say enough nice things about our three day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Treat everyone with kindness and respect.”
Reviews.Author: daytripperky
Reviews.Content: As mentioned quite frequently here, the hotel is nice. Despite having reserved 4 rooms earlier in the week, when we arrived, our rooms were not ready, which caused us to be late for our event. When I mentioned that I had the rooms reserved, the front desk person said that they were not ready because I had reserved 4 rooms (yet others were being checked in). Her attitude seemed to be that we didn't belong there anyway. Oh well, she perhaps had a bad day & we just happened to show up on her clock. The check-out person was somewhat better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hthmrtn
Reviews.Content: This Candlewood Suite is very nice and clean with studio apartments and the bedroom had a seperate area with its own Television. We were here a week while Hubby was working and it was a great experience. We loved the exchange DvD system with blockbuster movies at the front desk free of charge. The pool and hot tub area was very nice and quiet enclosed and indoors so while it rained a few days on our trip our children could still swim. This hotel was very pet friendly surprising by how nice and well kept it was. They had free washer and dryer service and though no breakfast on site we bought food at the local grocery store and the kitchen had everything we needed. The beds were comfortable but I would have preferred larger sleeping arrangements I am used to a California King bed at home and swear those were more double sized. Free Hi-Speed Internet, nice workout room. The area is about 20min from downtown but after touring Downtown was glad we choose a bit further back. I felt safe there it was quiet until Friday when Nascar fans came in for the Brickyard but overall we loved it and highly recommended the hotel to others. The front desk staff are very children and family friendly and the staff do only clean the rooms once a week if your staying more than four days so just exchange the linens at the front if you want more and they will give you what you need. My kids loved the cupboard the onsite store and it was very cheap and well done. You received a USA today each day you could go in there and just pick it up. Their is a sleeper sofa and more room for extended stays this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “That new hotel smell”
Reviews.Author: kcliss
Reviews.Content: This hotel, and some of the buildings around it, are brand new. The interior smells like a new car. Not unpleasant, but noticeable. The room, a one-bedroom suite, was spacious, although we would have like a King bed. We did manage to sleep two adults, two five-year-olds, and an eight year old, however. The full kitchen was a nice perk. Necessary, too, as the only food option is the honor-system snacks off the tiny lobby. No restaurant on-site, although the area has plenty to choose from. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the pool and hot tub were good-sized. A bit far from downtown, but it worked for us, as the family we were visiting was close by. Recommended for those not expecting the luxury treatment (ie: this is not Embassy Suites).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Extras”
Reviews.Author: DEW5245
Reviews.Content: We had a small fire in our house and needed a hotel to stay for 2 weeks while our house was being worked on. This hotel was perfect for us. They take pets and the suites were a very nice size. Our room had a Queen bed, pull out couch in the living room and a full size fridge, microwave and a two burner stove. The extras they have are a small store that has everything you could want for snacking or even to fix a meal in your room. They also have free DVD at the front desk that you can borrrow during your stay. The location is very close to everything Castleton has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mlmellencamp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Another person and I attended a conference in Indy. We had a 2 bedroom suite. Each room had a TV. There was a nice living area with a TV and a full kitchen. It was great for each of us to have our own room and TV. Parking was free and the shuttle would take us anywhere we wanted to go for dinner in the evening if we didn't want to drive. It's too far to walk downtown, but for us it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Candlewood Downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: AnnikaCarmel
Reviews.Content: This Candlewood was very nice! It had a full kitchen and the rooms were very big! Nicely decorated. Nice front desk. And the free shuttle and free parking was a big bonus, since most downtown locations charge for parking and charge for a shuttle service. The outdoor pool was great too. Very nice and clean.

HotelInfo.Name: Candlewood Suites Indianapolis
HotelInfo.Address: 8111 Bash Street, Indianapolis, IN 46250
